intro: Nonatelia varians, commonly known as the variable nonatelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
